title: 1992 New Territories West by-election
text:
The 1992 New Territories West by-election was held on 30 August 1992 after the incumbent Legislative Councillor <a href="Ng%20Ming-yum">Ng Ming-yum</a> of <a href="New%20Territories%20West%20%28constituency%29%231991%20Constituencies">New Territories West</a> died of blood cancer on 22 June 1992.
It was the second by-election in the constituency since the <a href="1991%20Hong%20Kong%20legislative%20election">1991 general election</a>. The two-time candidate, conservative <a href="Indigenous%20inhabitants%20of%20the%20New%20Territories%20%28Hong%20Kong%29">rural leader</a> <a href="Tang%20Siu-tong">Tang Siu-tong</a> defeated <a href="Albert%20Ho%20Chun-yan">Albert Ho Chun-yan</a>, vice chairman of the <a href="pro-democracy%20camp">liberal</a> <a href="United%20Democrats%20of%20Hong%20Kong">United Democrats of Hong Kong</a> (UDHK), and independent Sui See-chun with 51 percent majority, receiving 33,038 votes.
